TopicTitle: Why do you never visit Dres?

Articles.Content: FOR DRES!!!

> 
> 
> 46 minutes ago, Biff Space said:
> 
> 
> Dres is awesome! If you like rovers, Dres is the place! It is like Ike, but instead of loooong smooth inclines, it's all kind of bumpy, so you bounce and rattle up and down hill. Best driving in the system, without exception. 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Dres! Dres! Dres! Visit Dres!
> 
> 
> 
> 
> ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
> 

The Dreslian Tourism Board thanks you for your support!

I was going once, forget what version, but there was a double feature at the drive-in on Minmus of Plan 9 From Outer Space and It Came From Outer Space, so I flew in to take in the double feature and by the time they were over, I was tired and stopped by Mun for an ice cream on the way back home.

> 

Why would you stop by the mun for ice cream when minmus is ice cream??
I honestly forgot dres exisisted untill I saw this post...

Dres is just a boring grey space rock in the middle of nowhere. Duna is much more interesting and it's closer to Kerbin, and if you've got the dV to get to Dres you might as well go to Jool or any of its moons since it takes roughly the same amount of dV thanks to aerobraking and gravity assists. Hell, you can even get to Eeloo for the same dV!

**Edited <time datetime="2016-03-27T09:25:14Z" title="03/27/2016 09:25  AM" data-short="8 yr">March 27, 2016</time> by CaptainKorhonen**

> 
> 
> On 5/4/2015 at 10:18 AM, Caelib said:
> 
> 
> "It's small and relatively uninteresting. We will spend several hundred million dollars to determine that it's just another rock floating in space"
> 

Nope. It's full of water.

Primarily because back in my last serious career (1.0.2), I tended to launch interplanetaries, then spend the next six game sessions micromanaging things in Kerbin SoI. By the time the probe got to where it was originally going to intercept, either it or the planet was in the wrong place and getting to Dres' SoI would now cost thousands of the delta-vs ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif ":(") 

This is another reason I will be doing just one mission at a time in 1.1. 

I'm also hoping that some planet modder will do something with Dres to make it more visually interesting...
I've been to Dres before, I just landed on it few hours ago
I'll have you know I have a scanning probe heading to Dres right now! But it's not going to land... it's just going to scan... and then leave... nvm

Dres is the best planet! There is absolutely no reason you shouldn't visit Dres! Unless your a hater because I have a bunch of bases called fort knocks, and they will absolutely annilate any haters. Othere than that, it's awesome! I might send some whaa-I-want-more-snacks class tourism cruisers to Dres soon. 

DRES!!!

> Why do you never go to Dres?
> 

I actually go to it quite often, and I've found that the asteroids in it's orbit are handy for refueling without needing to actually land
Same reason I haven't been anywhere else beyond kerbin's <abbr title="Sphere of Influence">SOI</abbr>; the transfer window hasn't come up yet
Reasons why you shouldn't visit Dres: N/a

Well... it is my strong opinion that you shouldn't just visit Dres. You should *love* it, and show that love with an extravagant mission. Or better: [10 missions](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/153384-we-went-to-dres-to-give-it-some-love/)

![4o81CIB.png](http://i.imgur.com/4o81CIB.png)

Holy Moly Magzimum! Nice fleet!

The boffins back at <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> are concocting a new space station for Minmus orbit.... they're gonna make mine pretty much redundant and I've heard nasty words about the lander Ultraminer being over-engineered and in need to replacement. I'm considering using the Nerva on my space station to relocate to Dres along with Ultraminer. It seems a cool place to get away from it all and won't require aerobraking which suits me!

And being Dres, I don't think <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> will be coming after us any time soon!

PS: Any tips on getting an <abbr title="In-Situ Resource Utilization">ISRU</abbr> to output snacks? We've been out here for a while.

A 'planet' called dress shouldn't be as boring as Dres looks. If your girlfriend told you she had a new dress and then showed up in a piece of wardrobe which looks ordinary and just like three others she already has, why hyping it?

It's just the same colour as the Mun, Ike or Tylo. The formers are easier to reach and the latter way more challenging. A canyon? Got that on the Mun. Asteroids? You have them in Kerbin <abbr title="Sphere of Influence">SOI</abbr> as well. So why go there?

Its inclination makes it - literally - avoid any mission to the Joovian system which just makes sure you never get to dress - not even by accident.

I in fact do go to Dres. Its inclination makes it a fun challenge to plan missions for, whilst not being as difficult to reach as Moho, Eeloo, or Plock. I also go there because it's nice to visit every celestial body at least once.

Two reasons:  It has an awesome canyon!  That canyon on the moon just can't compare.  Wheeeeeee! (crash.  boom).

![SnJH0pC.png](http://i.imgur.com/SnJH0pC.png)

And the second:

Spoiler

**Edited <time datetime="2017-01-27T18:06:34Z" title="01/27/2017 06:06  PM" data-short="7 yr">January 27, 2017</time> by Whisky Tango Foxtrot**
Because i dont have to, neither do i want to.

I've never been to Dres because I've never been more than a few hundred km past Mun.  Now, once I get Munar landing down, visit Minmus (just to say I have) and get my ship design fully ironed out, a minor tweak will give me a ship with (I hope) enough <abbr title="Delta-V">dV</abbr> to get to Duna/Ike, Eve/Gilly, and possibly even Dres.

You know that clingy, annoying grandma? The one who hasn't said or done anything interesting since the Eisenhower administration, but you're still forced to visit her anyway? Your mom dresses you up in that ugly suit, wet- combs your hair, and admonishes you to be on your best behavior, only to leave you for hours with nothing to do except listen to the clock ticking in a dark room full of ugly gray furniture. And then when it's all done, you have to write her a thank- you letter talking about how much you enjoyed your visit and other assorted lies?

 Well, grandma's name is Dres. You never really visit her because you're excited to go, you really just go so you can say "there, I did it" and people will get off your back.

 Personally, I think Dres needs to be a little livelier. If she was the kind of grandma who used to tour with Dean Martin or made her own bathtub gin or skinned bears or sumpthin' , we'd all look *forward* to visiting her.

 But she's not livelier. She's just Dres.
